title: DkStyle
author: DkStyle
content: I just tried something so absurd that I want to share it, so others might save their time saving up with this website called loot.bet.It all started with me seeing them mentioned in a thread on here, and I thought I would give them a chance. Did not get any deposit bonus or anything like that. I just wanted to try out their sportsbetting service. I started by sending them a small deposit of 2 LTC(about 120 EUR). I placed 3 bets of 0.5 LTC with them on some minor league soccer that was about to start(nothing wrong with the games, just regular soccer matches). Got a lucky start and won all 3 for a total profit of just around 1.5 LTC(about 90 EUR). Then when I was going to place my bet number 4 for 0.5 LTC again, I was limited to a max stake of just around 3 EUR per bet! I never tried getting limited after just 3 bets and for such small amounts. It is just ridiculous to run a sportsbook like this. I am an overall losing bettor who just bets for fun, so why in the world they would limit my stakes to so little after 3 bets is just crazy. So just be aware that at this sportsbook, you apparently get limited if you win 3 bets in a row for a huge amount of 90 EUR But hey, I can always just lose my money elsewhere, so I'll just withdraw my deposit and small profit and bet elsewhere.. But it turns out it was not that easy to withdraw either. Smart thing about crypto is that it is fast to use. But not at loot.bet. After first waiting about 24 hours my withdraw request was suddenly just canceled and I got a message from someone in the chat telling me that I had to roll over my deposit one time due to their money laundering rules. Like anyone would bother to launder 120 EUR  So now I had to turn-over the last 0.5 LTC with their new super low limits. Luckly my deposit was so small that it was easy, but ironic that they do not want me to bet with them, and yet forces me to continue anyway. But keep this in mind if you deposit with them and they limit you this quickly, you might not be able to withdraw for some time, because they will force you to roll over with tiny bets. So next day I was done rolling the rest over, and actually lost, but thanks to them limiting me I did not lose much   So I put in another withdraw request for the balance. Nothing happens for about 30 hours.. So I contact them on the chat, and are now told that the withdraw is not processed because I had not verified the LTC address I send the deposit from. This is ofcause just another delay tactic since I requested the withdraw to the exact same address as the deposit came from, and I was already ID verified. At no point did they contact me to tell me this, first when I contacted them, they came up with this strange requirement. So after being told to upload a screen shot of the transactions from my wallet, and upload it under "bank card" my withdraw was finally processed almost 3 days after the initial request. All this hassle is over about 180 EUR. If this sounds like a great sportsbook to you, I can recommend that you go ahead and give loot.bet a try. If you do not like that sort of treatment, you might want to stay away from them

At first I think this has to do with the repuration of such casino and as such this topic should be moved to the reputation board here and furthermore, you would need to be patient with them so as to finish their processing as they claim to be processing it. I had to check for myself to see if the presence of this casino is recognized here and to my greatest surprise, they are fully represented here but are currently inactive which is not a good sign for a casino here. Here is the link to the casino announcement thread for you to see LOOT.BET and here you have the profile of their representative.  From the looks, their representative have not been active as well.These are the reasons why it is advisable to do your own research before engaging with casinos. I think you should have noted this if you had used the trustpillot review function to see for yourself what others are saying abut them.
